jspecview.util
Class JSpecViewUtils

java.lang.Object
  jspecview.util.JSpecViewUtils

public class JSpecViewUtils
extends java.lang.Object

JSpecViewUtils contains static methods used to calculate values for display of spectra and other utility methods used in the application.

Author:
Debbie-Ann Facey, Khari A. Bryan, Prof. Robert J. Lancashire

Nested Class Summary
static class JSpecViewUtils.MultiScaleData
          The inner class of JSpecViewUtils that stores information about scale and range that JSVPanel needs to to display a graph with a mutliple plots.
static class JSpecViewUtils.ScaleData
          The inner class of JSpecViewUtils that stores information about scale and range that JSVPanel needs to to display a graph with a single plot.

generateScaleData

public static JSpecViewUtils.ScaleData generateScaleData(Coordinate[] coords,
                                                         int start,
                                                         int end,
                                                         int initNumXDivisions,
                                                         int initNumYDivisions)
Calculates values that JSVPanel needs in order to render a graph, (eg. scale, min and max values) and stores the values in the JSpecViewUtils inner class ScaleData. Note: This method is not used in the application, instead the more general JSpecViewUtils.MultiScaleData is generated with the generateScaleData(jspecview.util.Coordinate[][], int[], int[], int, int) method

Parameters:
coords - the array of coordinates
start - the start index
end - the end index
initNumXDivisions - the initial number of X divisions for scale
initNumYDivisions - the initial number of Y divisions for scale
Returns:
returns an instance of ScaleData

generateScaleData

public static JSpecViewUtils.MultiScaleData generateScaleData(Coordinate[][] coordLists,
                                                              int[] startList,
                                                              int[] endList,
                                                              int initNumXDivisions,
                                                              int initNumYDivisions)
Calculates values that JSVPanel needs in order to render a graph, (eg. scale, min and max values) and stores the values in the JSpecViewUtils inner class ScaleData.

Parameters:
coordLists - an array of arraya of coordinates
startList - the start indices
endList - the end inices
initNumXDivisions - the initial number of X divisions for scale
initNumYDivisions - the initial number of Y divisions for scale
Returns:
returns an instance of MultiScaleData

applyShiftReference

public static void applyShiftReference(Coordinate[] xyCoords,
                                       int dataPointNum,
                                       double firstX,
                                       double lastX,
                                       double offset,
                                       double observedFreq,
                                       int shiftRefType)
                                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Applies the shift reference to all coordinates

Parameters:
xyCoords - an array of coordinates
dataPointNum - the number of the data point in the the spectrum, indexed from 1
firstX - the first X value
lastX - th elast X value
offset - the offset value
observedFreq - the observed frequency
shiftRefType - the type of shift
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

                                 javax.swing.JInternalFrame frame,
                                 boolean showDialog)
Integrates an HNMR spectrum

Parameters:
owner - parent container for JInternalFrame frame
frame - the selected frame
showDialog - if true then dialog is shown, otherwise spectrum is integrated with default values
Returns:
the panel containing the HNMR spectrum with integral displayed

getColorFromString

public static java.awt.Color getColorFromString(java.lang.String string)
Returns a Color from a string representation as a hex value or a delimiter separated rgb values. The following are all valid arguments: 
 "#ffffff"
 "#FFFFFF"
 "255 255 255"
 "255,255,255"
 "255;255;255"
 "255-255-255"
 "255.255.255"

Parameters:
string - the color as a string
Returns:
a Color from a string representation
